Coverage decreased (-0.01%) to 69.546% when pulling **9e6f3c00ac9ac908020cb9d9ad81ef1807c38ad7 on pabloem:ssampler-structured** into **a92c45f9347e326e71afdc9057cac7e053b6c3e6 on apache:master**.

r: @charlesccychen 
cc: @bjchambers 
This changes the state sampler to rely on structured names for MSEC counters.

The new io_target argument allows states to track time spent in IO such as side inputs, shuffle and state.  [Tests have passed ](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/14522/), and the latest commit only updates documentation.

I'm not familiar with this code, but by the class name `NonSerializableBoundedCombineFn` it seems that this is not intended to be serialized. @kennknowles can you shed any light on this?

If the class is intentionally non-serializable, then the proper fix would be to move the FindBugs suppression inline via `@SuppressWarnings` and remove from the `findbugs-filter.xml` file.

All the ITs are included in the Java SDK Post Commit Tests and have passed.

 - BigTable: https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_MavenInstall/4858/org.apache.beam$beam-runners-google-cloud-dataflow-java/testReport/org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.bigtable/

Actually, on closer look it seems like all findbugs suppressions should be in the filter. I think instead I should just edit the comment in the original suppression to explain why it's being suppressed and then close the JIRA issue.
LGTM

I'll need to look back at the code review for why this was considered a good idea. Certainly once the context is baked in it should not be serialized. But `CombineFn` is serializable, since that's the whole idea.
LGTM modulo passing of ValidatesRunner tests.

The problem is mostly in projects that have multiple runner dependencies. For example, `WindowedWordCountIT` fails to run because the examples project has a Scala 2.10 dependency from the Spark Runner and a Scala 2.11 dependency from the Flink Runner.

I'm afraid we have to introduce a project-wide Scala version property. What do you think?

Couldn't the examples depend on 2.10 fixed?

Coverage decreased (-0.01%) to 69.535% when pulling **89796f9a862f1fe1a5a04124f04a8132382af9b2 on tc-dc:bigquery-avro** into **aa2604a39f6f9a6f7d3273b61f224dbac358bb69 on apache:master**.

@aviemzur, do you mean the settings as below?

```
<relocation>
  <pattern>org.codehaus</pattern>
  <shadedPattern>
    org.apache.${renderedArtifactId}.repackaged.org.codehaus
  </shadedPattern>
  <excludes>org.codehaus.janino.CompilerFactory</excludes>
</relocation>
<relocation>
  <pattern>org.codehaus.commons.compiler.properties</pattern>
  <shadedPattern>org.apache.beam.sdks.java.extensions.sql.repackaged.org.codehaus.commons.compiler.properties</shadedPattern>
  <rawString>true</rawString>
</relocation>
```

A `org.apache.beam.sdks.java.extensions.sql.repackaged.org.codehaus.commons.compiler.properties` file may be better as the shade configuration above doesn't relocate file `org.codehaus.janino.CompilerFactory` janino.
Thanks. Merging.
@jkff I've just pushed new changes, could you please review?
@tgroh Thomas, could you please take a look at this PR?
LGTM

I tried to get the original PR to work with a project wide scala definition, but I failed. I don't remember the exact problem, but AFAIR it was maven voodoo for me. So you could try that again.

But in theory, it would be nice to support scala versions per runner, since it could be the case that e.g. the flink runner is buildable for 2.12, but the spark runner is not.

So regarding from this theoretical standpoint, no part of the build should actually depend on two scala versions, and (maybe) therefore not depend on two runners (in a single run).

I'm all for any solution to start with multi version scala support, though.
Fixed the test break by making some PAssert changes. PTAL.
